amplify.documentation: Amplify enables developers to develop and deploy cloud-powered mobile and web apps. The Amplify Console provides a continuous delivery and hosting service for web applications. For more information, see the Amplify Console User Guide. The Amplify Framework is a comprehensive set of SDKs, libraries, tools, and documentation for client app development. For more information, see the Amplify Framework.

methods.method_documentation: Creates a new Amplify app.

name.description: The name for an Amplify app.

description.description: The description for an Amplify app.

repository.description: The repository for an Amplify app.

platform.description: The platform for the Amplify app. For a static app, set the platform type to WEB. For a dynamic server-side rendered (SSR) app, set the platform type to WEB_COMPUTE. For an app requiring Amplify Hosting's original SSR support only, set the platform type to WEB_DYNAMIC.

iamServiceRoleArn.description: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for an Amplify app.

oauthToken.description: The OAuth token for a third-party source control system for an Amplify app. The OAuth token is used to create a webhook and a read-only deploy key using SSH cloning. The OAuth token is not stored. Use oauthToken for repository providers other than GitHub, such as Bitbucket or CodeCommit. To authorize access to GitHub as your repository provider, use accessToken. You must specify either oauthToken or accessToken when you create a new app. Existing Amplify apps deployed from a GitHub repository using OAuth continue to work with CI/CD. However, we strongly recommend that you migrate these apps to use the GitHub App. For more information, see Migrating an existing OAuth app to the Amplify GitHub App in the Amplify User Guide .

accessToken.description: The personal access token for a GitHub repository for an Amplify app. The personal access token is used to authorize access to a GitHub repository using the Amplify GitHub App. The token is not stored. Use accessToken for GitHub repositories only. To authorize access to a repository provider such as Bitbucket or CodeCommit, use oauthToken. You must specify either accessToken or oauthToken when you create a new app. Existing Amplify apps deployed from a GitHub repository using OAuth continue to work with CI/CD. However, we strongly recommend that you migrate these apps to use the GitHub App. For more information, see Migrating an existing OAuth app to the Amplify GitHub App in the Amplify User Guide .

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables map for an Amplify app.

enableBranchAutoBuild.description: Enables the auto building of branches for an Amplify app.

enableBranchAutoDeletion.description: Automatically disconnects a branch in the Amplify Console when you delete a branch from your Git repository.

enableBasicAuth.description: Enables basic authorization for an Amplify app. This will apply to all branches that are part of this app.

basicAuthCredentials.description: The credentials for basic authorization for an Amplify app. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

customRules.description: The custom rewrite and redirect rules for an Amplify app.

tags.description: The tag for an Amplify app.

buildSpec.description: The build specification (build spec) for an Amplify app.

customHeaders.description: The custom HTTP headers for an Amplify app.

enableAutoBranchCreation.description: Enables automated branch creation for an Amplify app.

autoBranchCreationPatterns.description: The automated branch creation glob patterns for an Amplify app.

stage.description: Describes the current stage for the autocreated branch.

framework.description: The framework for the autocreated branch.

enableAutoBuild.description: Enables auto building for the autocreated branch.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables for the autocreated branch.

basicAuthCredentials.description: The basic authorization credentials for the autocreated branch. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

enableBasicAuth.description: Enables basic authorization for the autocreated branch.

enablePerformanceMode.description: Enables performance mode for the branch. Performance mode optimizes for faster hosting performance by keeping content cached at the edge for a longer interval. When performance mode is enabled, hosting configuration or code changes can take up to 10 minutes to roll out.

buildSpec.description: The build specification (build spec) for the autocreated branch.

enablePullRequestPreview.description: Enables pull request previews for the autocreated branch.

pullRequestEnvironmentName.description: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

appArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amplify app.

description.description: The description for the Amplify app.

platform.description: The platform for the Amplify app. For a static app, set the platform type to WEB. For a dynamic server-side rendered (SSR) app, set the platform type to WEB_COMPUTE. For an app requiring Amplify Hosting's original SSR support only, set the platform type to WEB_DYNAMIC.

createTime.description: Creates a date and time for the Amplify app.

updateTime.description: Updates the date and time for the Amplify app.

enablePerformanceMode.description: Enables performance mode for the branch. Performance mode optimizes for faster hosting performance by keeping content cached at the edge for a longer interval. When performance mode is enabled, hosting configuration or code changes can take up to 10 minutes to roll out.

enablePullRequestPreview.description: Enables pull request previews for the autocreated branch.

pullRequestEnvironmentName.description: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

repositoryCloneMethod.description: This is for internal use. The Amplify service uses this parameter to specify the authentication protocol to use to access the Git repository for an Amplify app. Amplify specifies TOKEN for a GitHub repository, SIGV4 for an Amazon Web Services CodeCommit repository, and SSH for GitLab and Bitbucket repositories.

methods.method_documentation: Creates a deployment for a manually deployed Amplify app. Manually deployed apps are not connected to a repository.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.description: The name for the branch, for the job.

fileMap.description: An optional file map that contains the file name as the key and the file content md5 hash as the value. If this argument is provided, the service will generate a unique upload URL per file. Otherwise, the service will only generate a single upload URL for the zipped files.

jobId.description: The job ID for this deployment. will supply to start deployment api.

fileUploadUrls.description: When the fileMap argument is provided in the request, fileUploadUrls will contain a map of file names to upload URLs.

zipUploadUrl.description: When the fileMap argument is not provided in the request, this zipUploadUrl is returned.

methods.method_documentation: Deletes a job for a branch of an Amplify app.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.description: The name for the branch, for the job.

jobId.description: The unique ID for the job.

jobArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the job.

jobId.description: The unique ID for the job.

commitId.description: The commit ID from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitMessage.description: The commit message from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitTime.description: The commit date and time for the job.

startTime.description: The start date and time for the job.

status.description: The current status for the job.

endTime.description: The end date and time for the job.

jobType.description: The type for the job. If the value is RELEASE, the job was manually released from its source by using the StartJob API. If the value is RETRY, the job was manually retried using the StartJob API. If the value is WEB_HOOK, the job was automatically triggered by webhooks.

startTime.description: The time at which the logs should start. The time range specified is inclusive of the start time.

endTime.description: The time at which the logs should end. The time range specified is inclusive of the end time.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

logUrl.description: The pre-signed URL for the requested access logs.

autoSubDomainIAMRole.description: The required AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for automatically creating subdomains.

domainStatus.description: The current status of the domain association.

statusReason.description: The reason for the current status of the domain association.

certificateVerificationDNSRecord.description: The DNS record for certificate verification.

methods.method_documentation: Returns a job for a branch of an Amplify app.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.description: The branch name for the job.

jobId.description: The unique ID for the job.

jobArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the job.

jobId.description: The unique ID for the job.

commitId.description: The commit ID from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitMessage.description: The commit message from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitTime.description: The commit date and time for the job.

startTime.description: The start date and time for the job.

status.description: The current status for the job.

endTime.description: The end date and time for the job.

jobType.description: The type for the job. If the value is RELEASE, the job was manually released from its source by using the StartJob API. If the value is RETRY, the job was manually retried using the StartJob API. If the value is WEB_HOOK, the job was automatically triggered by webhooks.

steps.description: The execution steps for an execution job, for an Amplify app.

methods.method_documentation: Returns the webhook information that corresponds to a specified webhook ID.

webhookId.description: The unique ID for a webhook.

webhookArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the webhook.

branchName.description: The name for a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

createTime.description: The create date and time for a webhook.

updateTime.description: Updates the date and time for a webhook.

methods.method_documentation: Returns a list of the existing Amplify apps.

nextToken.description: A pagination token. If non-null, the pagination token is returned in a result. Pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

nextToken.description: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing apps from start. If non-null, the pagination token is returned in a result. Pass its value in here to list more projects.

methods.method_documentation: Returns a list of artifacts for a specified app, branch, and job.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.description: The name of a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

jobId.description: The unique ID for a job.

nextToken.description: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing artifacts from start. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in here to list more artifacts.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

nextToken.description: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

methods.method_documentation: Lists the backend environments for an Amplify app.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

environmentName.description: The name of the backend environment

nextToken.description: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing backend environments from the start. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in here to list more backend environments.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

backendEnvironments.description: The list of backend environments for an Amplify app.

nextToken.description: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

methods.method_documentation: Lists the branches of an Amplify app.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

nextToken.description: A pagination token. Set to null to start listing branches from the start. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in here to list more branches.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of records to list in a single response.

branches.description: A list of branches for an Amplify app.

nextToken.description: A pagination token. If a non-null pagination token is returned in a result, pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

nextToken.description: A pagination token. If non-null, a pagination token is returned in a result. Pass its value in another request to retrieve more entries.

branchName.description: The name for a branch.

methods.method_documentation: Starts a deployment for a manually deployed app. Manually deployed apps are not connected to a repository.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.description: The name for the branch, for the job.

jobId.description: The job ID for this deployment, generated by the create deployment request.

sourceUrl.description: The source URL for this deployment, used when calling start deployment without create deployment. The source URL can be any HTTP GET URL that is publicly accessible and downloads a single .zip file.

jobArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the job.

jobId.description: The unique ID for the job.

commitId.description: The commit ID from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitMessage.description: The commit message from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitTime.description: The commit date and time for the job.

startTime.description: The start date and time for the job.

status.description: The current status for the job.

endTime.description: The end date and time for the job.

jobType.description: The type for the job. If the value is RELEASE, the job was manually released from its source by using the StartJob API. If the value is RETRY, the job was manually retried using the StartJob API. If the value is WEB_HOOK, the job was automatically triggered by webhooks.

methods.method_documentation: Starts a new job for a branch of an Amplify app.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.description: The branch name for the job.

jobId.description: The unique ID for an existing job. This is required if the value of jobType is RETRY.

jobType.description: Describes the type for the job. The job type RELEASE starts a new job with the latest change from the specified branch. This value is available only for apps that are connected to a repository. The job type RETRY retries an existing job. If the job type value is RETRY, the jobId is also required.

jobReason.description: A descriptive reason for starting this job.

commitId.description: The commit ID from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitMessage.description: The commit message from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitTime.description: The commit date and time for the job.

jobArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the job.

jobId.description: The unique ID for the job.

commitId.description: The commit ID from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitMessage.description: The commit message from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitTime.description: The commit date and time for the job.

startTime.description: The start date and time for the job.

status.description: The current status for the job.

endTime.description: The end date and time for the job.

jobType.description: The type for the job. If the value is RELEASE, the job was manually released from its source by using the StartJob API. If the value is RETRY, the job was manually retried using the StartJob API. If the value is WEB_HOOK, the job was automatically triggered by webhooks.

methods.method_documentation: Stops a job that is in progress for a branch of an Amplify app.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.description: The name for the branch, for the job.

jobId.description: The unique id for the job.

jobArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the job.

jobId.description: The unique ID for the job.

commitId.description: The commit ID from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitMessage.description: The commit message from a third-party repository provider for the job.

commitTime.description: The commit date and time for the job.

startTime.description: The start date and time for the job.

status.description: The current status for the job.

endTime.description: The end date and time for the job.

jobType.description: The type for the job. If the value is RELEASE, the job was manually released from its source by using the StartJob API. If the value is RETRY, the job was manually retried using the StartJob API. If the value is WEB_HOOK, the job was automatically triggered by webhooks.

methods.method_documentation: Tags the resource with a tag key and value.

resourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use to tag a resource.

tags.description: The tags used to tag the resource.

methods.method_documentation: Untags a resource with a specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

resourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to use to untag a resource.

tagKeys.description: The tag keys to use to untag a resource.

methods.method_documentation: Updates an existing Amplify app.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

name.description: The name for an Amplify app.

description.description: The description for an Amplify app.

platform.description: The platform for the Amplify app. For a static app, set the platform type to WEB. For a dynamic server-side rendered (SSR) app, set the platform type to WEB_COMPUTE. For an app requiring Amplify Hosting's original SSR support only, set the platform type to WEB_DYNAMIC.

iamServiceRoleArn.description: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for an Amplify app.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables for an Amplify app.

enableBranchAutoBuild.description: Enables branch auto-building for an Amplify app.

enableBranchAutoDeletion.description: Automatically disconnects a branch in the Amplify Console when you delete a branch from your Git repository.

enableBasicAuth.description: Enables basic authorization for an Amplify app.

basicAuthCredentials.description: The basic authorization credentials for an Amplify app. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

customRules.description: The custom redirect and rewrite rules for an Amplify app.

buildSpec.description: The build specification (build spec) for an Amplify app.

customHeaders.description: The custom HTTP headers for an Amplify app.

enableAutoBranchCreation.description: Enables automated branch creation for an Amplify app.

autoBranchCreationPatterns.description: Describes the automated branch creation glob patterns for an Amplify app.

stage.description: Describes the current stage for the autocreated branch.

framework.description: The framework for the autocreated branch.

enableAutoBuild.description: Enables auto building for the autocreated branch.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables for the autocreated branch.

basicAuthCredentials.description: The basic authorization credentials for the autocreated branch. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

enableBasicAuth.description: Enables basic authorization for the autocreated branch.

enablePerformanceMode.description: Enables performance mode for the branch. Performance mode optimizes for faster hosting performance by keeping content cached at the edge for a longer interval. When performance mode is enabled, hosting configuration or code changes can take up to 10 minutes to roll out.

buildSpec.description: The build specification (build spec) for the autocreated branch.

enablePullRequestPreview.description: Enables pull request previews for the autocreated branch.

pullRequestEnvironmentName.description: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

repository.description: The name of the repository for an Amplify app

oauthToken.description: The OAuth token for a third-party source control system for an Amplify app. The OAuth token is used to create a webhook and a read-only deploy key using SSH cloning. The OAuth token is not stored. Use oauthToken for repository providers other than GitHub, such as Bitbucket or CodeCommit. To authorize access to GitHub as your repository provider, use accessToken. You must specify either oauthToken or accessToken when you update an app. Existing Amplify apps deployed from a GitHub repository using OAuth continue to work with CI/CD. However, we strongly recommend that you migrate these apps to use the GitHub App. For more information, see Migrating an existing OAuth app to the Amplify GitHub App in the Amplify User Guide .

accessToken.description: The personal access token for a GitHub repository for an Amplify app. The personal access token is used to authorize access to a GitHub repository using the Amplify GitHub App. The token is not stored. Use accessToken for GitHub repositories only. To authorize access to a repository provider such as Bitbucket or CodeCommit, use oauthToken. You must specify either accessToken or oauthToken when you update an app. Existing Amplify apps deployed from a GitHub repository using OAuth continue to work with CI/CD. However, we strongly recommend that you migrate these apps to use the GitHub App. For more information, see Migrating an existing OAuth app to the Amplify GitHub App in the Amplify User Guide .

appId.description: The unique ID of the Amplify app.

appArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amplify app.

name.description: The name for the Amplify app.

tags.description: The tag for the Amplify app.

description.description: The description for the Amplify app.

repository.description: The Git repository for the Amplify app.

platform.description: The platform for the Amplify app. For a static app, set the platform type to WEB. For a dynamic server-side rendered (SSR) app, set the platform type to WEB_COMPUTE. For an app requiring Amplify Hosting's original SSR support only, set the platform type to WEB_DYNAMIC.

createTime.description: Creates a date and time for the Amplify app.

updateTime.description: Updates the date and time for the Amplify app.

iamServiceRoleArn.description: The AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service role for the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amplify app.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables for the Amplify app.

defaultDomain.description: The default domain for the Amplify app.

enableBranchAutoBuild.description: Enables the auto-building of branches for the Amplify app.

enableBranchAutoDeletion.description: Automatically disconnect a branch in the Amplify Console when you delete a branch from your Git repository.

enableBasicAuth.description: Enables basic authorization for the Amplify app's branches.

basicAuthCredentials.description: The basic authorization credentials for branches for the Amplify app. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

customRules.description: Describes the custom redirect and rewrite rules for the Amplify app.

lastDeployTime.description: The last deploy time of the production branch.

status.description: The status of the production branch.

thumbnailUrl.description: The thumbnail URL for the production branch.

branchName.description: The branch name for the production branch.

buildSpec.description: Describes the content of the build specification (build spec) for the Amplify app.

customHeaders.description: Describes the custom HTTP headers for the Amplify app.

enableAutoBranchCreation.description: Enables automated branch creation for the Amplify app.

autoBranchCreationPatterns.description: Describes the automated branch creation glob patterns for the Amplify app.

stage.description: Describes the current stage for the autocreated branch.

framework.description: The framework for the autocreated branch.

enableAutoBuild.description: Enables auto building for the autocreated branch.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables for the autocreated branch.

basicAuthCredentials.description: The basic authorization credentials for the autocreated branch. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

enableBasicAuth.description: Enables basic authorization for the autocreated branch.

enablePerformanceMode.description: Enables performance mode for the branch. Performance mode optimizes for faster hosting performance by keeping content cached at the edge for a longer interval. When performance mode is enabled, hosting configuration or code changes can take up to 10 minutes to roll out.

buildSpec.description: The build specification (build spec) for the autocreated branch.

enablePullRequestPreview.description: Enables pull request previews for the autocreated branch.

pullRequestEnvironmentName.description: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

repositoryCloneMethod.description: This is for internal use. The Amplify service uses this parameter to specify the authentication protocol to use to access the Git repository for an Amplify app. Amplify specifies TOKEN for a GitHub repository, SIGV4 for an Amazon Web Services CodeCommit repository, and SSH for GitLab and Bitbucket repositories.

methods.method_documentation: Updates a branch for an Amplify app.

appId.description: The unique ID for an Amplify app.

branchName.description: The name for the branch.

stage.description: Describes the current stage for the branch.

enableAutoBuild.description: Enables auto building for the branch.

environmentVariables.description: The environment variables for the branch.

basicAuthCredentials.description: The basic authorization credentials for the branch. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

enableBasicAuth.description: Enables basic authorization for the branch.

enablePerformanceMode.description: Enables performance mode for the branch. Performance mode optimizes for faster hosting performance by keeping content cached at the edge for a longer interval. When performance mode is enabled, hosting configuration or code changes can take up to 10 minutes to roll out.

buildSpec.description: The build specification (build spec) for the branch.

ttl.description: The content Time to Live (TTL) for the website in seconds.

displayName.description: The display name for a branch. This is used as the default domain prefix.

enablePullRequestPreview.description: Enables pull request previews for this branch.

pullRequestEnvironmentName.description: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

backendEnvironmentArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a backend environment that is part of an Amplify app.

enableNotification.description: Enables notifications for a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

updateTime.description: The last updated date and time for a branch that is part of an Amplify app.

enablePerformanceMode.description: Enables performance mode for the branch. Performance mode optimizes for faster hosting performance by keeping content cached at the edge for a longer interval. When performance mode is enabled, hosting configuration or code changes can take up to 10 minutes to roll out.

thumbnailUrl.description: The thumbnail URL for the branch of an Amplify app.

basicAuthCredentials.description: The basic authorization credentials for a branch of an Amplify app. You must base64-encode the authorization credentials and provide them in the format user:password.

buildSpec.description: The build specification (build spec) content for the branch of an Amplify app.

ttl.description: The content Time to Live (TTL) for the website in seconds.

associatedResources.description: A list of custom resources that are linked to this branch.

enablePullRequestPreview.description: Enables pull request previews for the branch.

pullRequestEnvironmentName.description: The Amplify environment name for the pull request.

destinationBranch.description: The destination branch if the branch is a pull request branch.

sourceBranch.description: The source branch if the branch is a pull request branch.
